articles.title: No power or cell service? Life-saving satellite tech available on your iPhone, Android - NBC2 News
articles.description: In light of potential power outages and disrupted cellular services, knowing how to send a distress signal via satellite could be a lifesaver.

articles.title: Your doctor’s office could be reading your blood pressure all wrong - Ars Technica
articles.description: 54 million US adults may be misdiagnosed with high BP based on bad readings.

articles.title: Samsung foldable that debuted at $2K in 2020 stops receiving security updates - Ars Technica
articles.description: Newer Samsung Galaxy phones are promised seven years of updates.

articles.author: Cranfield University
articles.title: With advanced scanning technique, confiscated Iron Age Iranian swords proven to be pastiches - Phys.org
articles.description: For the first time, an imaging method has been used to investigate Iron Age bronze Iranian swords, revealing significant modern modifications that prove the weapons have been altered to increase their commercial value in the illicit antiquities market.
